info.title: PicPay 1-Click
info.description:
# Introduction
A API do PicPay 1-Click was developed 
com based on REST model, following current standard 
technical of market. All the URLs use the protocol 
HTTP  as authentication,  verbs and return codes.

## AUTHENTICATION AND AUTHORIZATION
All communication uses tokens for authorization, in 
compliance withOpenID Connect and 
OAuth 2.0 specifications. The tokens are created from authentication 
with the credentials provided by PicPay, and from 
user authorization as shown in our guide.

post.description:
This feature enables the seller to charge the user's wallet. If the seller chooses to confirm the amount after the customer's authorization, 
it is necessary to send the parameter `auto_capture` with the value `false`, indicating that the authorized amount will only be temporarily reserved (delayed capture).
 If the `auto_capture` parameter is not specified, it will automatically assume the value `true`, following the automatic capture flow.
 For more details on how the `capture` endpoint works, refer to [_Capture Charge_](#operations-Payments-cancelPayment).

post.summary: Performs cancellation of an uncaptured transaction.
post.description:
This feature allows the seller to cancel an authorized transaction awaiting capture.
For orders with authorized payments awaiting capture, it is possible to cancel the transaction in advance, always for the total amount, as long as the waiting period is within 5 days of the capture request. This prevents any possibility of charge and makes the consumer's balance available for new purchases.

Two possible identifiers can be used: `transaction_id` or `reference_id`. The `transaction_id` is PicPay's identifier returned in a successful charge. The `reference_id` is the identifier generated by the partner and sent in the charge request. At least one of the identifiers **needs** to be sent. When both are sent, both will be validated.

tokenNotFound.description: Response when the resource is called without the access token.

badTokenFormat.description: Response when the resource is called with a token that is not a valid JWT.

post.description:
The payment capture, whether partial or total, is performed under the condition that the transaction is 
created with the `auto_capture` field set to `false` and the consumer has made the payment. 
A request will be awaited to finalize the charge, with the correct value indicated in the `value` field. 
The value can be equal to or less than the authorized amount. If the `value` field is not provided, the transaction will be captured for the total amount. 
Captures with a value higher than the authorized amount will be 
rejected.


**Information:**
- Capture request is only allowed when the transaction is authorized. In the event that the 
capture request does not occur within 5 calendar days from authorization, the transaction is automatically canceled. 

- After a successful capture, even if partial, it will not be possible to request
a new capture of the same transaction.

Two possible identifiers can be used: `transaction_id` or `reference_id`. The `transaction_id` is PicPay's identifier returned in a successful charge. The `reference_id` is the identifier generated by the partner and sent in the charge request. At least one of the identifiers **needs** to be sent. When both are sent, both will be validated.

post.summary: Perform a full or partial refund
post.description:
This resource allows the seller to perform a full or partial refund of a payment. If you specify a refund amount less than the amount charged, a partial refund of the transaction will be processed. If the `value` field is not provided, the transaction will be refunded for the total amount.

Two possible identifiers can be used: `transaction_id` or `reference_id`. The `transaction_id` is PicPay's identifier returned in a successful charge. The `reference_id` is the identifier generated by the partner and sent in the charge request. At least one of the identifiers **needs** to be sent. When both are sent, both will be validated.

200.description: Full or partial refund successfully completed.
